intro: Hedeoma micrantha, commonly known as narrowleaf hedeoma, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. Hedeoma micrantha is a low-growing perennial that plays a role in stabilizing soils in its native habitat.
